name: places/ChIJ1U2aLeZYwokRxteduHVRwK8
formattedAddress: 330 E 61st St, New York, NY 10065, USA
adrFormatAddress: 330 E 61st St, New York, NY 10065, USA

originalText.text: I have been to Equinoxs all over NYC and many across the country. This location is by far the best, in my humble opinion, for multiple reasons.  The first time I went, I thought it was a sports club and I got access by accident. Is the decor modern, no. But there are 7 - 8 levels and a rooftop to chillout on. Basketball, pool, jacuzzi... this club has more amenities than the sports club on the west side of Manhattan.  There are 2 full cables, in addition to mini-cables, which is a plus for me. In addition, they have such a variety of modern exercise equipment I haven't seen at other locations.  The locker room, showers, and steam room are throw-back from the 50s, but that's the cherry on top. I have honestly only been to this location 2 - 3 times with my year at Equinox. I wish I lived closer, and I would simply cancel my all access and go to this one. It is that big, and that varied and that good.   I have never written a review about a gym before, but Google asked for my opinion, and here it is.

originalText.text:
No other gym in Manhattan has 1/2 the space or machine/weights availability as this location. Staff is always super nice.

The people in these reviews have it all wrong--the outdated 80s/90s aesthetic of this place is a feature not a bug. Who doesn't, at least for a few hours a week, want to get in a time machine and sling iron like Patrick Bateman? Who doesn't want to yuck it up about how Japan is the future in the sauna?

originalText.text:
I shared this on YELP as well.

I’m an all access member visiting from LA and decided to use the 61st location due to it being close to my bnb and it was the largest gym in NYC. This will be a review of the club from my experience. I visited the gym from Aug15-Sep25 overall my experience was good.

This is the part where I would like to focus on the Greet Team.
There were moments when other members made the front desk jobs way too hard though they handled it with stride.

I would like to shout out 2 specific greeters, Danielle and Logan. These two were the faces I saw most while frequenting the gym. Danielle was very sweet and catering to my needs. My first time there she explained everything so great any questions I had she didn’t hesitate to answer.

Logan was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!! I saw him more than anyone especially in my last couple weeks. His personality alone is what made my gym experience great. I was always greeted and sent home with a smile and compliment. It must be the southern charm he brings, more people should take note. I personally feel he was the backbone of this gym. During my duration I’ve seen him settle disputes between other male gym members on several occasions. He was verbally assaulted by a mad woman for about 2 hours about a week ago. If you noticed I speak in past tense when talking of Logan. I found out that Logan was let go from equinox due to the incident with the lady and his “poor behavior”. The lady was a Karen and this is coming from a white woman.

Management is atrocious!!! The general manager Joe is a disrespectful prejudice pig. The way he treats his staff members is awful. I’ve never seen a general manager introduce themselves and conduct business sweaty, out of breath, and the worse part he was in workout gear.

Corporate should really look into this gym and how it’s ran. The gym has the equinox title but it doesn’t have the look. My next trip here I will definitely try out one of the other gym to see how they stand to this one.

originalText.text: A lot of people hate the old school/gritty vibe, but I think that’s part of the charm: this gym never feels crowded. It has a sauna and a steam room

text.text: A lot of people hate the old school/gritty vibe, but I think that’s part of the charm: this gym never feels crowded. It has a sauna and a steam room

originalText.text:
I am putting 5 star review since the staff was super nice and tried to help me as much as possible. I moved to HY and tried to get executive room access which I already had it here, but the staff at HY was super rude and not helping, and they basically asked me to pay another initiation fee and more monthly pay. During the whole 5 visit no one was kind enough explain the whole situation, but here 61st staff was super nice and very kind. I still come here instead of HY even though it is 10 min walk from house. It is worth to take 30min train since it is comfortable.
The gym is super big. A little old but it is NYC, so ;) But they are constantly renovating.
